page.title: 01Location, Turvey
page.content: The area is gently undulating, attractive landscape, traversed by the upper reaches of the River Ouse.To the west is open landscape,predominantly an arable farming area based on Boulder clay above 200 feet and light gravelly soils in the river valley.To the east of the river is more arable farming and some pasture,the most outstanding feature being the parkland around Turvey. A band of Oolitic limestone runs through the area,once quarried and used for local building. Many of the limestone buildings date from 18th and 19th century. The increasingly busy A428 road crosses the area.Traffic travels fast even through the villages.A by-pass for Turvey is proposed which will pose major problems through this area.
